qas.question: In what year did Queen release No-One but You
Who was No-One but You dedicated to?
Which compilation did Queen release in 1997?
Who performed live with Queen on The Show Must Go On in 1997?

answers.text: Elton John and the Béjart Ballet

context: In <a0_0>1997<a0_0/>, Queen returned to the studio to record "No-One but You (Only the Good Die Young)", a song dedicated to <a1_0>Mercury<a1_0/> and all those that die too soon. It was released as a bonus track on the <a2_0>Queen Rocks<a2_0/> compilation album later that year. In January 1997, Queen performed "The Show Must Go On" live with <a3_0>Elton John and the Béjart Ballet<a3_0/> in Paris on a night Mercury was remembered, and it marked the last performance and public appearance of <a4_0>John Deacon<a4_0/>, who chose to retire. The Paris concert was only the second time Queen had played live since Mercury's death, prompting Elton John to urge them to perform again.
